definition: to not know the reason/to not know what to do
(negative prefix)/not/no
to know/to be aware
actually/place/classifier for houses, small buildings, institutions etc/that which/particle introducing a relative clause or passive/CL:個|个[ge4]
old variant of 以[yi3]
to use/by means of/according to/in order to/because of/at (a certain date or place)
abbr. for Israel 以色列[Yi3 se4 lie4]
old variant of 以[yi3]

sentences.english: Was a vast expanse of whiteness as PianPianRan didn't know so.
sentences.chinese: 白茫茫一片，就像翩翩然不知所以。

sentences.english: When he saw his companions climb, he followed them without purpose.
sentences.chinese: 当他看到同伴们往上爬时，不知所以的就跟著往上爬。

sentences.english: I think we're getting a little ahead of ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 我想我们有点不知所以了。

sentences.english: My daydreams aren't even dreaming. I feel bored, lost, uninterested in much of anything.
sentences.chinese: 甚至不再幻想，我不知所以，心烦意乱，了无生趣。

definition: not to understand the situation/unaware of the ins and outs
to feel puzzled
not knowing what to do (idiom); at one's wits' end/embarrassed and at a complete loss
at a loss (idiom)
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
to not know what sb is driving at/to be unintelligible
variant of 莫名其妙[mo4 ming2 qi2 miao4]
to be unable to make any sense of the matter/to be at a loss
to be confused/to be baffled
to feel dizzy/to be confused/to be at a loss/to stare blankly/Taiwan pr. [fa1 meng2]
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to feel perplexed
helpless
blankly/vacantly/at a loss
puzzled/bewildered
staring stupidly/petrified
